qas.question: What year was Grande Ile classified as a World Heritage site?
What is the culture in Strasbourg?
What is the largest Islamic place of worship in France?
When was the Strasbourg Grand Mosque inaugurated?
What is the second largest university in France?

Besides Catholics and Protestants who else attends the University of Strasbourg?

context: Strasbourg's historic city centre, the Grande Île (Grand Island), was classified a World Heritage site by UNESCO in <a0_0><b5_0><b9_0>1988<b9_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, the first time such an honour was placed on an entire city centre. Strasbourg is immersed in the <a1_0>Franco-German<a1_0/> culture and although violently disputed throughout history, has been a bridge of unity between France and Germany for centuries, especially through the <a4_0><b6_0>University of Strasbourg<b6_0/><a4_0/>, currently the second largest in France, and the coexistence of Catholic and Protestant culture. The largest <b8_0>Islamic<b8_0/> place of worship in France, the <a2_0>Strasbourg Grand Mosque<a2_0/>, was inaugurated by French Interior Minister Manuel Valls on <a3_0>27 September <b7_0>2012<b7_0/><a3_0/>.
